text:
welcome to how to cook that I am ann reardon
today we are going to make an
oreo no bake cheesecake.
If you want it to look like an actual oreo then the first thing that you need
to do is the make the details to go on top out of cookie dough.  The recipe for the
cookie dough is on the website you can follow the link in
the description below this video.  Roll out your cookie dough and then cut out the
letters to make 'oreo', two triangles, then use a straw to cut out some mini cirlces
and then cut lots of strips and cut them into tiny rectangles, to go around the edge of the cheesecake

the cheesecake.  Arrange your letters and cut out an oval big enough to fit around the  ranges latest content
added i have a big enough to feed durant
word 'oreo'. Bake them in the oven.  They won't take long becasue they are quite

small pieces so probably five, ten
minutes and they'll be done. Next
make the fudgey brownie base and top.  Take your oreaos and separate them into the

biscuit bit and the filling
Place the cookie part into a plastic bag and crush it
with a rolling pin until you have fine crumbs.
Next put your butter
into a bowl and melt it in the microwave
add the eggs and whisk it in
pour int he sugar and mix it around well.
Now it's time to add the cocoa powder and self raising flour.
roughly chop some dark chocolate and  add it to your mixture then finally
add in the crushed oreos.  not the filling bit just the cookie bit of it.
Stir with a spoon until just combined.
Grease and line two tins with baking paper
Tip half of the mixture into each and spread to the
edges
bake in the oven until they are just cooked
right into the centre you can put a knife into the centre to check that they are not still
liquid
Take them out of the oven, run a knife around the edge and then take the tin in both
hands and shake it up and down and turn the pan and shake it up and down until you can
feel that it's loose on all sides.  Then place a cooling rack covered in baking
paper on the top
and flip it over to turn it out
Then put that to one side to cool completely.  To make you filling firstly sprinkle some
gelatin over some cold water
and then set that aside
Put the cream cheese in the bowl of an electric mixer
and whip until smooth
tehn pour in your sugar and your oreo stuffing from earlier, I hope you didn't eat it and then pour in your
milk
and mix that up

by now your gelatin will have bloomed  
which means it's absorbed all the water
and swollen up
Microwave it until it is melted but watch it carefully to make
sure it doesn't bubble over in the microwave.
then pour that into the mixture while the beaters are running.  Roughly chop up the
rest of your oreos then

line a container on the sides and the
base with baking paper
and pour in some of the mixture

sprinkle over the oreos, trying to keep
them in the middle because we want the

outside of our cheesecake to look white like
it does on an oreo
add some more of your mixture and repeat that until you have used it all up.
Then using a spoon push any pieces that have gone to the edge back into the middle.
The n
place that in the freezer

to set.  To assemble your cheesecake use a
little melted chocolate to put your

letters in place, then your triangles and
the little rectangles all the way around the
edge and add your other details.
Then take your frozen cheesecake

pull at the paper on the sides to loosen and
pull out the cheesecake

peel a paper off the bottom of the
cheesecake and place it centre off the
base and peel the paper off the edge.
Then add you top layer and put it into place.
